banner.job: I am a Front End Developer
banner.text: Welcome to Web Development Journey! From Functionality to Design, I Push the Limits with the Art of Coding. While Reshaping the Digital World, I Offer Customized Solutions for Your Needs. Let's Work Together to Turn Your Dreams into Reality with Code!

about.title: About Me
paragrafs: My interest in front-end web development is not only a hobby but also my career focus. In general, I have a good command of modern technologies such as Next.js, React and TypeScript, and I am constantly striving to advance myself in this field. I focus on learning new things and improving my skills every day. In this way, I closely follow the developments in the field of web development and have the opportunity to apply the latest technologies.

I am also able to use the powerful backend infrastructure provided by Laravel very well. I have been involved in many projects developed with Laravel and have integrated the front-end parts of these projects with technologies such as React or Next.js to create user-friendly and high performance web applications. In addition to the powerful structure offered by Laravel, I have designed and developed the front-end of web applications by using the blade template engine effectively.

In this process, I not only wrote code, but also paid attention to design and usability issues. I created aesthetic and user-friendly interfaces using various tools and techniques to maximize the user experience. In this way, I made it easier and more enjoyable for users to use web applications.

projects.title: WEBOVA
projects.description: I have developed a small CSS framework as a lightweight alternative to Bootstrap, using SCSS. This custom framework includes the features required for specific projects of mine and offers a more optimized style creation process without the unnecessary overhead of unused components. It prioritizes performance and ease of use

projects.title: F1RF1R
projects.description: This JavaScript library facilitates the creation of notification messages and popup dialogs. It features an easy-to-use and flexible structure, providing developers with the ability to quickly implement and customize notifications, confirmations, and other interactive elements in web applications. The library adopts a minimalist approach, prioritizing performance and ease of integration while never compromising functionality

projects.title: Datasurgery
projects.description: I contributed to the frontend development of a web-based demo product aimed at predicting thyroid cancer using artificial intelligence. My tasks included implementing an image annotation tool that allows doctors to segment data by drawing on images. This tool captured the coordinates of the annotations and transmitted them to the backend. Additionally, I served as a mobile developer on a mobile application project enabling expert radiologists to remotely consult with patients. My role involved implementing user interfaces and ensuring the functionality of the application across various devices and operating systems.

projects.title: Lena Optik
projects.description: In this application developed using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and TypeScript, I explored both the frontend and backend worlds, also working with Laravel Blade templating. Embracing a user-centric approach, I struck a perfect balance between both appearance and functionality. Each page and element was adorned with consistent design using Laravel Blade templating, bolstered by JavaScript and TypeScript. While working on this project, I had the opportunity to acquire new knowledge about both Laravel and frontend technologies. By stepping into both frontend and backend realms simultaneously, I continue to strive for self-improvement.
